Posts.Content: mistymoley kazash56 I'm sorry to hear that you are struggling. Did your  oncologist give you the statistics for taking anastrozole?  The % difference may not be significant enough to continue, but if it is, do talk to your team and see if there are options for you.  I was told the first two years on Tamoxifen were shown to have the biggest effect, so I stopped around this time, but you have to do what is right for you.  I think it might feel worse as a man, as the oestrogen strips muscles of strength and you will feel the fatigue as a result.  If you haven't already, you could try different  brands, do have a search through the groups to find what people have tried. Hi. Mistymoley. I phoned BCN and she is going to arrange appointment with onc.  she thinks they will change meds from Anastrozol to something else. Hope so this fatigue is getting unbearable. Xxx
Posts.Title: 3yrs post cancer... I a man struggling with fatigue and this new life...

Posts.Content: Hi. I'm suffering with terrible fatigue like you and it's making me feel so down.  I started treatment June 2015 chemo.  Mastectomy   December 2015  radiotherapy Feb 2016. Followed by Herceptin which finished last December. I am now taking anastrozol . At first I had hardly any side effects but the last three months have been terrible.  Hot flushes  I ache all over but the fatigue is the worst. Some days I feel like I haven't got the energy to breath nevermind anything more strenuous.  I have been told it is a side effect of anastrozol and I am starting to question whether I want to stay on this drug. I feel  90 not 59. It's really getting me down.  Hope you are doing ok. Xx
Posts.Title: 3yrs post cancer... I a man struggling with fatigue and this new life...

Posts.Content: Hi LL.  Just got courage up to call BCN for mammogram results and everything fine. Feel like I can get on with things now and not keep thinking the worst.  Hope everythings good with you. Love Kaz xx
Posts.Title: Controlling Anxiety while waiting for results!

Posts.Content: kazash56 I know what you mean. I had my first mammogram last Wednesday and I am a nervous wreck waiting for results. I am on herceptin and anastrosol and I keep having discomfort in my breast I keep telling the doctor's and they just keep saying it's hormones but I can't get it out of my head it might be something more serious. When I ot my mammogram appointment I spoke to my bcn and she said oh it's just your 12 month follow up appointment we're not expecting to find anything wrong just give me a call next Wednesday or Thursday and I'll try and chase it up for you.  Don't they realise how anxious.we get waiting for results.  I'm too scared to phone her today in case it is bad news yet I want to know so hopefully I can get on with my life.  Hope you are feeling OK.  Xxxx

Posts.Content: Thanks for your good wishes.  Appointment at 2. 45 .  husband not home from work yet to go with me.  Why do men do this.need help not stress
Posts.Title: ha

Posts.Content: Have a appointment this afternoon to see what treatment has been decided for me after having scan on Friday. I know I have to have a mastectomy but don't know what else yet. I'm terrified they are going to say it has spread to other parts.  Every time I get a pain or niggle I keep thinking its the cancer in another part of my body.
Posts.Title: ha

Posts.Content: Hi.  I used simple baby bath all through chemo. Surgery and radio therapy therapy which I finished in feb. With no problems.  In fact I am still using it now.   Keep well.  Xx
Posts.Title: Bathing

Posts.Content: I might give it a try as so many people have said how it has helped them when pain meds have not worked. I was a bit worried about side affects with Asthma as I also have it. Glad to hear how yours has improved. Xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole- cannabis oil

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with BC in 2015 and am in remission.   I have Fibromyalgia and someone said canibis oil is good for pain. I am on Anastrozole and wondered if I would be able to take it . Has anyone else tried it.
Posts.Title: Anastrozole- cannabis oil

Posts.Content: I have finished my chemo and am now waiting to go for a scan to see if it has shrunk the lump enough to have a lumpectomy instead of a mastectomy. I have a appointment for a week on Wednesday to see surgeon to discuss options but I am feeling quite scared  thinking about the what ifs. You know what if the scn shows it has spread or if the lump has shrunk will it have grown bigger again before my op.. Everybody keeps saying you've got the worst part over with,meaning the chemo but they don't understand that is just part of it and there is still a long way to go. I didn't have my last chemo because I ended up in hospital with neutrpenia and infection nearly every time .now fatigue is driving me mad because I can't do things I need to do and my damn nails are falling off.  Sorry for moaning. I just had to get things off my chest to to people who understand what I am ranting on about.
Posts.Title: Feeling a bit lost

Posts.Content: had good news.  chemo has shrunk lump to almost undetectable so i can now have a lumpectomy to remove what is left.  op next thursday.  can anybody give me any advice on what nightwear and tops will be best to wear.  i will have a drain in for about 10 days  any other advice welcome.
Posts.Title: what to wear

Posts.Content: I know this sounds stupid but I just don't know what to drink. I know they say to drink 2lt of liquid a day but I just can't seem to do it.  I hate fizzy pop.don't really like dilute and can't think of anything I really fancy. Any ideas please.
Posts.Title: Drinks

Posts.Content: Had my first docytexal on Wednesday and feel floored. Started with bad pains in my legs on Friday and spent Sunday night and Monday in hospital with high temp and pain.they can't find any infection but I have been sent home on penicillin. Just wondered if anyone on docytexal feel like their stomach is on fire can't eat and even water is like drinking acid. Any advice appreciated.
Posts.Title: Docytexal

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzyrascal.  The docetaxol is. Awful. I have had 3 fec and this was my first T. Fec wasn't too bad but this.you try to be positive and get on with like usual and then the side affects kickin and you just have admit you can't do it.  So annoying. Hope it wares off soon.  Keep well Kaz. X
Posts.Title: Docytexal

Posts.Content: I know what you mean.. I have temp of 38.8. Which they are not worried about as they can find no infection and my bloods are good. My heart was racing as well and I am getting itchy rash on hands and nails hurt. Thought I would put  hubby a stew in slow cooker so he wouldn't have to cook when he came home from work. I put meat and water iin dish then started to peel veg and the pain and weakness in my arms was unbelievable. Been resting in bed most of day. Hope next one not as bad as this.
Posts.Title: Docytexal

Posts.Content: chloecat45 Hi Kazash56 Was on Anastrozole but was changed to Letrozole when Anastrozole stopped working.  However Letrozole didn't work for me at all so may be going on Arimidex.  Will know today.  Alternatively could be put onto exemestane.  Only ever had the hot flushes with these hormone inhibitors. However I note that you have been on Anastrozole for 19 months and I suspect that you have had various brands in that time.  Did you notice if any particular brand gave you less side effects?  Alternatively you could ask if you could be put onto Arimidex to see if you get less side effects or none at all!  Anastrozole is the generic form (patent now expired meaning other pharma can now make it) of Arimidex and it's the fillers that cause the side effects. It is always worth an ask. Hi Chloecat45. I have tried different brands and found Accord to best for me. One brand (beginning with W ) didn't suit me at all.  I thought I was doing ok but seem to have lots of side effects hit me all at once . Just hope to get things sorted as soon as possible as it's really getting me down at the moment. Xx
Posts.Title: Changing from anastrozol

Posts.Content: tessiecat1 Hello Kazash, could have written your letter myself! Been 2 years on anastrozole, now found to have osteoarthritis, particularly bad in spine. Have had second DEXA scan which showed worsening osteopenia (have been taking Adcal D3) and nearly 2" height loss. Took myself to Oncs and now taking bisphosphonates and told to change from anastrozole to either tamoxifen or exemestane. As I'm post menopause decided against tamox and will be taking my first exemestane tomorrow (that is of course if Boots will eventually have it in stock!!).  I've also had tendonitis in thumb, had corticosteroid injection which has sorted that out. I take 20mg amitriptyline at night and now get to sleep, and can get through without waking up with back/leg pain - do need to get up for loo, but able to get back to sleep - something I had not been able to do for months.  Have put EVERYTHING that is now wrong with me down to the anastyzole (even though it could be me now at the great age of 63).  It seems to be the devil or the deep blue sea - even the exemestane give side effects of joint pain. ARRGHGHGH, so does the bifossywhatsits - took my first one Monday (and shush -  managed to sit/stand for 1/2 hour and didn't feel nauseous, or have any other pains, perhaps I shouldn't look at the side effects leaflet, but so far so good). I saw a BCN, even though I'd asked to see the Onc, and BCN had to go rushing off and see Onc for advice, then thrust the tamox & eme leaflets at me, said to make up my mind & ask my doc to prescribe them, no info on the bifossy at all, moan, whinge, and moan again. Still, I'm still here and even though I'm like a crab getting down the stairs in the morning, movement does ease up after a while.  Am doing lots of exercises to improve bone strength and keep muscles moving.  Don't really feel much back pain due to the amittrip - which I find amazing, but it did work.   Oooh, have wittered on far too long. Hope some of it gives you some help.  My doc has been fantastic, always wih the belief that 'something can be done about pain', so very grateful to her - she's been more help that BCN!   You should not have to continually suffer pain like that. Do you have a good doc? Hugs to you. Let me know how you get on. xxx Hi.Tessiecat1". The things we have to put up with.  We are going away for a long weekend tomorrow and I'm dreading it with all the aches and pains and having no energy. When I had my DEXA scan they found out I already had osteoporosis so have to take acid tab and calcium. I'm really lucky to have a brilliant BCN. If I tell her of any worries I have you can bet there will be a appointment in the post within a few days to get things checked.  I had to laugh thinking of you getting down the stairs like a crab. We must look a right pair in a morning trying to get our bodies to work.LOL. let me know how you go on with the Exemestane.  Take care. Xx
Posts.Title: Changing from anastrozol

Posts.Content: I have been on Anastrozol for 19 the months and have been having some bad side effects.for the last 3 months.  Joint and muscle pain.  Terrible fatigue.  Trigger finger. Can't sleep.  I spoke to my Breast care nurse today and she thinks my oncologist will suggest changing to something else.  What is everyone else on and how do they find the side effects.  I have been told there is three other options tamoxifen being one of them. Any help appreciated.
Posts.Title: Changing from anastrozol
